Close top ad Banshee (Legacy of the Void) ============================ From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see [Banshee (Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Banshee (Heart of the Swarm)") , [Banshee (Wings of Liberty)](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Wings_of_Liberty) "Banshee (Wings of Liberty)") and [Banshee (Wings of Liberty Campaign)](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Wings_of_Liberty_Campaign) "Banshee (Wings of Liberty Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Terran](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/1/1e/Terran_race_icon.png/30px-Terran_race_icon.png%20%22Terran%22) Banshee [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/8/88/SC2Banshee.jpg/600px-SC2Banshee.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Banshee.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/8/88/SC2Banshee.jpg/600px-SC2Banshee.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Banshee.jpg) Unit Information Type: Air Unit Description: Tactical strike aircraft. Built From: [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") with [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/0b/Buildtime_terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  43 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/b/ba/Supply-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  3 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : E Attack 1: Backlash Rockets Targets: Ground Damage: 12 (+1) (x2) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 27 (+2.25) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 0.89 [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 6 Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 140 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") Energy: 50 / 200 Sight: 10 Speed: 3.85 (+1.4) Strong against: * [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") * [Ultralisk](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") * [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") Weak against: * [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") * [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") * [Viking](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Spells](#Spells) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Banshee** is a strong Air-to-Ground unit that is built from a [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") with a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Starport "Tech Lab") add-on. The Banshee has a number of common uses. Used early on in any match-up, they can catch an opponent off guard and allow for uninterrupted harassment, especially if [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") has been researched. For this reason, hiding two Starports can be devastating for an opponent if left unscouted. When supported by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , Banshees can be used to form a very powerful air army that can be very hard for Protoss to deal with. Spells\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Spells")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/2/27/Cloak.png/61px-Cloak.png)](/starcraft2/File:Cloak.png) | **Caster:** [Banshee](/starcraft2/Banshee "Banshee")

**[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a9/EnergyIcon.gif)](/starcraft2/Energy "Energy")
** 25 (-1.26 / s)

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** C

The Banshee cloaks itself, turning invisible until it runs out of energy. | Upgrades\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Upgrades")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Cloaking Field](/starcraft2/SCUpgrade/Banshee_Cloaking_Field_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "SCUpgrade/Banshee Cloaking Field (Legacy of the Void)") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/2/27/Cloak.png/61px-Cloak.png)](/starcraft2/File:Cloak.png) | **[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")

Increases the movement speed of Banshees from 3.85 to 5.25. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * A Banshee can fire off salvos of rockets rather quickly, and one shot from two of them will kill any worker in one hit. Thus, if built early, upgraded with Cloak, and properly microed to only fire at mineral gatherers, they can destroy an opponent's entire economy within seconds. This strategy is highly unlikely to work more than once, since the enemy will be very careful with his detectors and workers after such a devastating attack. * Since [Wings of Liberty](/starcraft2/Wings_of_Liberty "Wings of Liberty") , Banshees worked, when rushed, as a precursor to a 2-3 [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") push or a faster-than-normal 3rd mining base, in match-ups when openings til mid-game did not include a [Spire](/starcraft2/Spire "Spire") , [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") or [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") in any fashion, many players would simply get [Detection](/starcraft2/Detection "Detection") and ground-based anti-air; hence Siege Tanks being effective for the range advantage. * Since the introduction of the [Liberator](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") in Legacy of the Void, amongst other economic changes, Banshees have declined in popularity, as the liberator is able to one-shot workers by itself, is 50 gas cheaper than a pair of banshees, and does not require an attached tech lab. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Against Protoss, Banshees can be a devastating attack force due to relatively weak anti-air capabilities of the Protoss Army. On the ground that a single [Shield Battery](/starcraft2/Shield_Battery "Shield Battery") recharges shield much faster than damage dealing of several banshees, a minimum number of 2 banshees is recommended to one-shot [Probes](/starcraft2/Probe "Probe") . The Cloaking ability of the Banshee can lead to surprise attacks should the Protoss not have [Observers](/starcraft2/Observer "Observer") accompanying their army, or any detection around their mineral lines. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Banshees are a common opener in TvT, especially with [Cloak](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") , due to its ability to outmicro [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") and the potential to inflict significant damage to an opponents economy. However, they are vulnerable to [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , [Missile Turrets](/starcraft2/Missile_Turret "Missile Turret") and especially [Cyclones](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") combined with [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") . Without either speed upgrades which is the common situation, banshees remain the same moving speed as cyclones', hence once targeted by Lock On banshees are unable to leave without the help of cliffs or other terrains. If you can gain air dominance, they can be used to snipe key units from the opponent's ground army, usually [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , without much resistance. However, the main usage for Banshees remains harassment. Banshees do find a "niche" use for resource harassment in the mid-late game after researching hyperflight rotors. Still, they're far less common than [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") . If the opponent neglected placing Missile Turrets in his base, a couple of Banshees can devastate vulnerable mineral lines and/or coerce him into sacrificing an [Orbital Command](/starcraft2/Orbital_Command "Orbital Command") 's energy for [Scanner Sweeps](/starcraft2/Scanner_Sweep "Scanner Sweep") that could otherwise have been invested into [MULEs](/starcraft2/MULE "MULE") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Banshees can be somewhat effective in ZvT, although [Spore Crawlers](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler "Spore Crawler") , [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") and [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") \* can buy enough time for [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") to come out, at which point Banshees shouldn't be used because they lack any anti-air capabilities. A Banshee can defeat one [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , and with Cloak this becomes a non-issue. Zerg players can use the semi-mobile [Spore Crawler](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler "Spore Crawler") turret for both damage and detection, in combination with Queens, or upgrade to [Lair](/starcraft2/Lair "Lair") have access to [Overseer](/starcraft2/Overseer "Overseer") [Detectors](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") as well as the major Zerg anti-air unit, the [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") . A successful Banshee rush can transition into an immediate end-game, or set the Terran player far ahead in the macro while his Zerg opponent recovers. Against early game [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") \-based rushes banshees are quite essential since neither [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") or [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") can target air units. However banshees are vulnerable to some [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") \-dropping rushes. _\*Note: Hydralisks have 5 range (without the upgrade), while Banshees have 6 range - correct micro can mean that before the Hydralisk upgrade comes out Banshees can outrange them._ Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/50/Banshee.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Banshee.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | \[[hide](#)

html:
Banshee (Legacy of the Void)

From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki
This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see Banshee (Heart of the Swarm), Banshee (Wings of Liberty) and Banshee (Wings of Liberty Campaign).
[e][h] Banshee
Unit Information
Type:
Air Unit
Description:
Tactical strike aircraft.
Built From:
Starport with Tech Lab
Cost:
 150  100  43  3
Hotkey:
E
Attack 1: Backlash Rockets
Targets:
Ground
Damage:
12 (+1) (x2)
DPS:
27 (+2.25)
Cooldown:
0.89
Range:
6
Unit stats
Defense:
140 0 (+1)
Attributes:
Light, Mechanical
Energy:
50 / 200
Sight:
10
Speed:
3.85 (+1.4)
Strong against:
  • Colossus
  • Ultralisk
  • Siege Tank
Weak against:
  • Hydralisk
  • Phoenix
  • Viking

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Upgrades
  • 4 Competitive Usage
    • 4.1 General
    • 4.2 Vs. Protoss
    • 4.3 Vs. Terran
    • 4.4 Vs. Zerg
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Quotes
  • 7 Patch Changes
  • 8 References

Description[edit]

The Banshee is a strong Air-to-Ground unit that is built from a Starport with a Tech Lab add-on. The Banshee has a number of common uses. Used early on in any match-up, they can catch an opponent off guard and allow for uninterrupted harassment, especially if Cloak has been researched. For this reason, hiding two Starports can be devastating for an opponent if left unscouted. When supported by Vikings, Banshees can be used to form a very powerful air army that can be very hard for Protoss to deal with.

Spells[edit]

Cloak
Caster: Banshee
25 (-1.26 / s)
Hotkey: C
The Banshee cloaks itself, turning invisible until it runs out of energy.

Upgrades[edit]

Cloaking Field
100
100
79
Hotkey: C
Researched from: Tech Lab
Allows Banshees to use the Cloak ability.
Hyperflight Rotors
125
125
100 s
Hotkey: B
Researched from: Tech Lab
Increases the movement speed of Banshees from 3.85 to 5.25.

Competitive Usage[edit]

General[edit]

  • A Banshee can fire off salvos of rockets rather quickly, and one shot from two of them will kill any worker in one hit. Thus, if built early, upgraded with Cloak, and properly microed to only fire at mineral gatherers, they can destroy an opponent's entire economy within seconds. This strategy is highly unlikely to work more than once, since the enemy will be very careful with his detectors and workers after such a devastating attack.
  • Since Wings of Liberty, Banshees worked, when rushed, as a precursor to a 2-3 Siege Tank push or a faster-than-normal 3rd mining base, in match-ups when openings til mid-game did not include a Spire, Stargate or Starport in any fashion, many players would simply get Detection and ground-based anti-air; hence Siege Tanks being effective for the range advantage.
  • Since the introduction of the Liberator in Legacy of the Void, amongst other economic changes, Banshees have declined in popularity, as the liberator is able to one-shot workers by itself, is 50 gas cheaper than a pair of banshees, and does not require an attached tech lab.

Vs. Protoss[edit]

Against Protoss, Banshees can be a devastating attack force due to relatively weak anti-air capabilities of the Protoss Army. On the ground that a single Shield Battery recharges shield much faster than damage dealing of several banshees, a minimum number of 2 banshees is recommended to one-shot Probes. The Cloaking ability of the Banshee can lead to surprise attacks should the Protoss not have Observers accompanying their army, or any detection around their mineral lines.

Vs. Terran[edit]

Banshees are a common opener in TvT, especially with Cloak, due to its ability to outmicro Marines and the potential to inflict significant damage to an opponents economy. However, they are vulnerable to Vikings, Missile Turrets and especially Cyclones combined with Ravens. Without either speed upgrades which is the common situation, banshees remain the same moving speed as cyclones', hence once targeted by Lock On banshees are unable to leave without the help of cliffs or other terrains. If you can gain air dominance, they can be used to snipe key units from the opponent's ground army, usually Siege Tanks, without much resistance. However, the main usage for Banshees remains harassment.

Banshees do find a "niche" use for resource harassment in the mid-late game after researching hyperflight rotors. Still, they're far less common than Liberators. If the opponent neglected placing Missile Turrets in his base, a couple of Banshees can devastate vulnerable mineral lines and/or coerce him into sacrificing an Orbital Command's energy for Scanner Sweeps that could otherwise have been invested into MULEs.

Vs. Zerg[edit]

Banshees can be somewhat effective in ZvT, although Spore Crawlers, Queens and Hydralisks* can buy enough time for Mutalisks to come out, at which point Banshees shouldn't be used because they lack any anti-air capabilities. A Banshee can defeat one Queen, and with Cloak this becomes a non-issue.

Zerg players can use the semi-mobile Spore Crawler turret for both damage and detection, in combination with Queens, or upgrade to Lair have access to Overseer Detectors as well as the major Zerg anti-air unit, the Hydralisk.

A successful Banshee rush can transition into an immediate end-game, or set the Terran player far ahead in the macro while his Zerg opponent recovers. Against early game Roach-based rushes banshees are quite essential since neither Roaches, Ravagers or Zerglings can target air units. However banshees are vulnerable to some Queen-dropping rushes.

*Note: Hydralisks have 5 range (without the upgrade), while Banshees have 6 range - correct micro can mean that before the Hydralisk upgrade comes out Banshees can outrange them.

Gallery[edit]

Quotes[edit]

Built Selected Annoyed Move Attack Under Attack

  • Please turn off all cell phones, Gauss rifles, EMP:s, psionic waveform emitters and plasma-based perdition flamethrowers. Thanks, and have a great flight!
  • What's the vector, Victor? Give me the clearance, Clarence.[q 2]
  • Looks like I picked the wrong day to quit stim packs.[q 2]
  • Anyone else know how to fly this thing? No? I'll wing it...

Banshee's quotes (video and sound) - YouTube video.

Patch Changes[edit]

[hide][show]Patch 3.8.0 [1]
  • Removed the Fusion Core requirement for the Hyperflight Rotors upgrade.
  • Research Hyperflight Rotors upgrade time increased from 93 to 121.
[hide][show]Patch 4.7.1 [2]
  • Hyperflight Rotors upgrade cost decreased from 200/200 to 150/150.
[hide][show]Patch 5.0.11 [3]
  • Hyperflight Rotors research time reduced from 121.4 to 100 seconds.
  • Hyperflight Rotors cost reduced from 150/150 to 125/125.

References[edit]

  1. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (22 November 2016). "Legacy of the Void - Patch 3.8.0 -- November 22, 2016". Battle.net.
  2. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (20 November 2018). "STARCRAFT II 4.7.1 PATCH NOTES". Battle.net.
  3. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (23 January 2023). "STARCRAFT II 5.0.11 PATCH NOTES". Battle.net.
